body:
What I can do is:
- Make the anomaly_mode.h header Python agnostic.
- Keep the anomaly_mode.cpp Python dependant.
- Use NO_PYTHON in engine.cpp and function.h to make sure nothing from anomaly_mode.h is used.

Is that what you want? Or you would like the NO_PYTHON to disapear from engine.cpp and function.h as well? Like having an anomaly_mode_cpp_only.cpp that implement the same api for cpp only builds? and one cpp is in the python build and the other in the cpp only build?
body_html:
What I can do is:

  • Make the anomaly_mode.h header Python agnostic.
  • Keep the anomaly_mode.cpp Python dependant.
  • Use NO_PYTHON in engine.cpp and function.h to make sure nothing from anomaly_mode.h is used.

Is that what you want? Or you would like the NO_PYTHON to disapear from engine.cpp and function.h as well? Like having an anomaly_mode_cpp_only.cpp that implement the same api for cpp only builds? and one cpp is in the python build and the other in the cpp only build?
body_text:
What I can do is:

Make the anomaly_mode.h header Python agnostic.
Keep the anomaly_mode.cpp Python dependant.
Use NO_PYTHON in engine.cpp and function.h to make sure nothing from anomaly_mode.h is used.

Is that what you want? Or you would like the NO_PYTHON to disapear from engine.cpp and function.h as well? Like having an anomaly_mode_cpp_only.cpp that implement the same api for cpp only builds? and one cpp is in the python build and the other in the cpp only build?
